did.abstract: This ledger documents the Roane Iron Company from its founding in 1867 until its bankruptcy in 1932. Among these records are the minutes from corporate board meetings and shareholders meetings.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collections are stored offsite, and a minimum of 24 hours is needed to retrieve these items for use. Researchers interested in consulting any of the collections are advised to contact Special Collections.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection remain with the creator. For more information, contact the Special Collections Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of Item], Roane Iron Company Ledger, MS.1120. University of Tennessee Libraries, Knoxville, Special Collections.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Note
acqinfo.p: Tom Ward donated this ledger to the University of Tennessee's Special Collections Library in November of 1982.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Note
bioghist.p: Union veteran John Wilder founded the Roane Iron Company in 1867. The company created the town of Rockwood (Roane County) Tennessee, where its blast furnaces were located. The enterprise went bankrupt in 1932.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: This ledger documents the Roane Iron Company from its founding in 1867 until its bankruptcy in 1932. Among these records are the minutes from corporate board meetings and shareholders meetings.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection consists of a single box.
